_description: Prognostications from the amount of thunder in the months of the year — twelve quatrains in couplets

CULFf548.First Lines:
When thonder comeþ in IaneuereÞou shalt haue þat
                    ilke ȝereMyche frute and gret werreOf folk þat life vnder
                    sterre…
CULFf548.Last Lines:
…We shal þorow þe grace of owre LordeHaue pees and
                    gyrþe goode acorde
CULFf548.Note:
Headings for each stanza, e.g. ‘Janeuere sol in
                        aquario’ for first.
CULFf548.Attributed Title:
Here sueth a tabull of diuerse moneth in the ȝere If thonder be herd
                    in theym what it betokeneth After her seyng that ar holdyn wyse men of soch
                    thyngus (f. 9v)
CULFf548.Editions:
Förster,  Max. 
             “Beiträge zur mittelalterlichen Volkskunde, VI-VII.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         128 (1912): 55-71; 285-308: 285-7.
Downing,  Janay Young A.,
                        ed.  
             “A Critical Edition of Cambridge University MS Ff.5.48.” 
         2 vols. Diss. University of Washington, 1969: 19-21.

DurCathB334.First Lines:
Wan [thonder] comes in ianuariþan is [ ] ilk [
                    ]…
DurCathB334.Last Lines:
…Pray we alle þat it so beAmen amen for
                    carite
DurCathB334.Note:
29 couplets, two for each month except July with three, plus an
                    eight-line conclusion; names of the months in rubric to right of each 4-line
                    grouping.

NLS1931.First Lines:
When þe thoner cummes in Ianuereþen schall we haue
                    þat ilke ȝereMecull fryutte & ille weyreOf folke
                    þat ben vnstere…
NLS1931.Last Lines:
…& corne shall wax a parti derehongur betokens þe
                    wext ȝere
NLS1931.Note:
Five quatrains, rhyming aabb, for first five months, interspersed with
                        5489, both written as
                    prose.
NLS1931.Facsimiles:
Hardman,  Phillipa. 
             The Heege Manuscript: A Facsimile of National Library of Scotland MS
                Advocates 19.3.1.
         Leeds Texts and Monographs, n.s. 16. Leeds: School of English,
            2000.
